net.sourceforge.waters.model.marshaller

Interface ProxyMarshaller<D extends DocumentProxy>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    JAXBCounterExampleMarshaller, JAXBMarshaller, JAXBModuleMarshaller, JAXBProductDESMarshaller

    public interface ProxyMarshaller<D extends DocumentProxy>

    The basic marshaller interface.

    The ProxyMarshaller provides the basic means for the DocumentManager to marshal, i.e., save documents in various file formats.

    Author:
    Robi Malik

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getDefaultExtension()
      Gets a default extension for the files written by this marshaller.
      FileFilter getDefaultFileFilter()
      Gets a default file filter that accepts the files with default extension.
      Class<D> getDocumentClass()
      Gets the class of documents handled by this marshaller.
      void marshal(D docproxy, File filename)
      Writes a document to a file.

    • Method Detail

      • marshal

        void marshal(D docproxy,
             File filename)
      throws WatersMarshalException,
             IOException
        Writes a document to a file.
        Parameters:
        filename - The name of the file to be written.
        docproxy - The document to be written.
        Throws:
        WatersMarshalException - to indicate a failure while writing the data structures.
        IOException - to indicate that the output file could not be opened or written.

      • getDocumentClass

        Class<D> getDocumentClass()
        Gets the class of documents handled by this marshaller.

      • getDefaultExtension

        String getDefaultExtension()
        Gets a default extension for the files written by this marshaller.

      • getDefaultFileFilter

        FileFilter getDefaultFileFilter()
        Gets a default file filter that accepts the files with default extension. Only one file filter is created, and this method ensures that the same object is returned by each call.
